definition: strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: Crosswalks even got a fresh coat of paint to encourage walking and biking.
sentences.chinese: 过街天桥上都挂上鼓励步行和骑车的条幅。

sentences.english: Painter baishi-qi a banner, painted just below the painting of the three chicks.
sentences.chinese: 白石老人一幅条幅，画的下方只画了三只小鸡。

sentences.english: Everywhere, there were processions of young people with bands and banners.
sentences.chinese: 街上到处是年轻人们举着条幅游行。

sentences.english: Crosswalks een got a fresh coat of paint to encourage walking and biking.
sentences.chinese: 过街天桥上都挂上鼓励步行和骑车的条幅。

sentences.english: Let's do it this way. In a few days I'll use my brush to write a scroll for you.
sentences.chinese: 这样吧，我随后用毛笔写个条幅寄给你，怎么样？

sentences.english: Dots of silver light float on the big purple scroll, they are like the splashed spray.
sentences.chinese: 紫色的大条幅上，泛着点点银光，就像迸溅的水花。

definition: rhyming couplet/pair of lines of verse written vertically down the sides of a doorway/CL:副[fu4],幅[fu2]
to hang up (a picture, banner, mosquito net etc)
Spring Festival couplet (the first line of which is pasted on the right side of a doorway at New Year, and the second on the left side)
